ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: You learn a fair bit about French. Your written abilities will see a faster and larger improvement than your oral abilities.
advanced french grammar, vocabulary, and some specific elements of french culture (mostly about the elementary education system in france)

Recommend this course for the improvement of oral and auditory comprehension skills. Grammar and vocabulary are major components as well but I would describe them as secondary to conversational skills and reading skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: In keeping with the course's reputation, it's just a bit too difficult. They push you way harder than other language courses.

strengths- variety of french texts and movies
weaknesses- lack of time spent practicing speaking skills in class

The department is rigorous but accommodating and certainly committed to supporting students wherever possible. Sometimes the course is too fast-paced for comprehension and only manageable when you resort to memorization and drilling exercises, but you definitely learn a lot.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you want to learn French, this is the way to do it.

I would reccommend this course to a student planning on majoring or minoring in French, not a student that is just interested in learning the language because the course is taught from a primarily academic view rather than social, cultural, or speaking.

I recommend this course but would advise you not to underestimate the workload. You only reap the benefits of the course if you truly engage with it and practice regularly, so it is a considerable time commitment. Daily classes are extremely helpful for consistent improvement and regular practice.
